10036642802TejasB11111False6FalseFalse1Texas, USA8/[YEAR-0]9/1/[YEAR-0]It's completely overpriced for the actual quality you receive!This was the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel!!This hotel was really dirty...the hot tub has dirt on the floor and on the bench...you can clearly tell it hasn't been cleaned in FOREVER! The pool was so cold you couldn't even get in and it was dirty too! This AFTER we waited over an hour for the maintenance guy to fix the door so we could actually get into the pool area. I had to call the front desk twice to get that done!! The bathtub in the room had stains that I could not remove after trying to clean it myself. For what we paid for this room for one night, they did not even offer a continental breakfast yet the rude front desk guy informed me I could purchase breakfast (for a ridiculous price per person) in the hotel restaurant. We were already paying above what was reasonable for that level of quality and to not offer breakfast is ridiculous!!! The room has two air vents in the ENTIRE room and the air goes on and off which is very frustrating...the room remained hot and never felt comfortable (yet the air was working properly) no matter how low we turn it down. The guy at the front desk was on a personal call when I walked up one time to ask a question and actually rolled his eyes and stated "what do you need?!" Ummm...this was the worst experience we have ever had a hotel and considering the cost of the whole thing I would NEVER stay here again!! We checked out other hotels in the area (due to having to return to the area in a couple months) and would stay at those over this hotel in a heartbeat!!! This hotels offer either continental breakfasts or breakfast buffets at their restaurants at a way lower price than this place, Take my advice....BOOK SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!

1005132833Visiting242553True6FalseFalse28/[YEAR-0]9/2/[YEAR-0]Room TemperatureIn a August [YEAR-0] stay at the hotel the room temperature was too cold and couldn't be adjusted. We set the thermostat to 70 deg. The fan cycled between the loud high speed and low all night but the temperature didn't go up. The engineer came to service it and said that the default setting had been changed from 72 to 68 deg and at 68 the fan would remain on low speed and wouldn't cycle to high speed. He said all the room thermostats defaulted to 68 deg and there was no way to increase the room temperature. So there was no point in switching rooms during our six day stay.
10053647814Goalie5955555True56FalseFalse2Cleveland, Ohio8/[YEAR-0]9/2/[YEAR-0]Great service, ideal location and very clean2Both the staff and hotel accommodations were excellentWe reserved 4 rooms for 13 people, all who were family members. My wife and I requested a suite so we could have a little more room to have everyone meet to converse and mingle. We were upgraded into the Presidential Suite much to our surprise with an oceanfront room. It by far exceeded anything we would have ever anticipated or expected. The staff were very polite and were able to meet or exceed any request we had. I would like to recognize two people in particular...Robert who helped immensely with loading and unloading our vehicles and finding us places to park. He also helped with suggestions of where to eat and what was going on in Virginia Beach in case we were interested in attending. The other was Tia at the front desk who resolved an issue with my vehicle in the parking lot. Both employees acted professionally yet treated us like they've known us for years. Both employees should be commended for their representation of Belvoir.

1008226390Chloe[YEAR-0]45555True38FalseFalse2Albany, NY, USA8/[YEAR-0]9/2/[YEAR-0]Good location and friendly staff1Clean & ComfyWe took a quick 4 day get away to tour Washington DC. While I was told the nearest Metro was "around the corner", it was actually about a 7-10 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel does offer a shuttle service to Ronald Reagan International Airport, where there is a Metro stop, however the shuttle runs on the 1/2 hour. The hotel and our room was clean. There are no safes in the room, the "safety deposit box" is at the main desk. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Bed was comfy, especially after a day of touring DC and being on our feet all day. Aside from construction at a nearby site, the hotel was very quiet. The room was very clean. Be aware that the shuttle runs on the hour after 8 pm and the last pickup from the airport is 11 pm. Overall, we would definitely stay there again.

10149038353Sarah75735152False6FalseFalse3Austin, TX, USA8/[YEAR-0]9/3/[YEAR-0]Poor ManagementI have stayed at this hotel many times and typically enjoy it very much. My most recent stay was a terrible exception. The hotel is under renovation and the staff clearly was not prepared to handle the problems renovations can bring. The day I was there, some sort of housekeeping problem prevented rooms from being ready at check in. The staff did not handle the situation well at all. I was repeatedly told my room would be ready in an hour and when I returned to the registration desk, I would stand in line for 20-30 minutes with other angry guests only to be told it would be another hour. I watched while one guest after another left the registration desk in frustration. What added to the frustration was the nonchalant attitude the staff seemed to have. They seemed completely unconcerned that guests could not get into their rooms even though check in time had long passed. I finally had to leave for a 7:00 dinner reservation and on the way to the restaurant I received a call indicating my rooms were ready. I had specifically reserved 2 rooms with 2 beds each and asked them to be sure to hold those as I had 5 people in my party, including adults who did not want to share a bed. By the time we returned from dinner they had given one of the rooms away and only had a king room available. After a conversation with the manager and several trips to various rooms (none of which had 2 beds), I finally gave up and took a king room. By this time it was 10:30 PM. The manager was apologetic, but clearly unequipped to address the situation. He offered no compensation, so I took it upon myself to suggest that he comp one of the rooms. He agreed to do so, but the fact that I had to ask after having arrived at the hotel at 2:30 and not getting into my room (and the wrong one at that) until 10:30 PM was ridiculous. Grandbourne typically provides a high level of customer service. This was not the case at all the Belvoir New Orleans. I would not recommend staying here until all the renovations are complete.

101927611506Bellevuebound23222False3FalseFalse28/[YEAR-0]9/4/[YEAR-0]Final stay at this hotelI travel to Seattle often and stayed at the Belvoir Bellevue to be close to my team this trip. I returned to my room after my first day of meetings around 6 to find that the room had not been touched. I know there is a program to receive more points if your room is not cleaned but I did not put out the card to participate. I called the front desk (dialing 0 as the quick call buttons on the phones in the room do not work). The response I received was "your room was missed, that happens sometimes". Neither apology nor even any apparent concern that this would be a problem. I told the agent that this was not the level of service I expected and suggested it may be time for me to stay somewhere else. The response was I'm sorry to hear that. I would have expected at least some effort to keep a customer and resolve an issue. The agent finally did offer to send someone up to the room and that did happen quickly and the room was cleaned. I don't mind having issues when I travel but I do expect the hotel to have some accountability and concern over missed service and make some attempt to keep my business. If the housekeeping staff at the hotel does regularly miss rooms and the management does not think this is a problem then they will be losing more business than just mine. I have a lot of hotel options in the Bellevue area and for my next trip I will staying at a different hotel.

102322931474Sandra2714142False28FalseFalse1Huntsville, AL, USA9/[YEAR-0]9/5/[YEAR-0]2Unhappy GuestI booked a room at this hotel about a week to a week and a half in advance. Apparently, I was no better off. As soon as I got there to check in, the front desk clerk told me that since they were so booked up, they had to put us in a tiny room (pinching her fingers with about an inch of space between); stating there was that little space between the bed and tv (and bed and wall). She offered us free breakfast to make up for this. Now had she just welcomed us and made it sound like they were giving us free breakfast without mentioning the room was tiny in comparison to others, we never would have known! Then the air unit was showing 60 degrees; well it was more like 76. It was humid and the floor felt damp. We called and they sent an "engineer" to fix the unit. He told us to wait 30 minutes. It was just as bad off as when we got there. They offered us free Starbucks, however that does not make up for paying for an expensive room to sweat all night and barely move past the tv and bed to get to the bathroom. After entirely too much back and forth on the phone, they offered to move us. So they did have a regular room available?! It took them a good hour to move us. Will not stay here again! Book elsewhere! Somewhere with updated units! They need customer service training as well.

102332711400Brad100000055555True34FalseFalse3St Louis, MO9/[YEAR-0]9/5/[YEAR-0]Very nice hotel amid vast array of mediocre suburban hotel options.4Low key luxuryEnjoyed my stay in this newer high rise hotel in Overland Park. The hotel has a nice indoor pool, outdoor patio with bar, a small exercise room, a full service restaurant, Starbucks coffee bar, and a club lounge -- all are very nice, but the club lounge is too small for how many rooms it serves. Valet parking is offered, but free self parking is convenient. The hotel is separate from other commercial development, so you'll need a car to drive, but lots of good restaurants and newer shopping are nearby. Weekend rates here are a great value; I would highly recommend staying based on my experience.

10235874760Liquid208344554True26FalseFalse2Fort Lauderdale, FL, USA8/[YEAR-0]9/5/[YEAR-0]2This hotel has great featuresThe hotel was much better than my last experience at Belvoir Suites in Tampa, FL. It is right on Smathers Beach, although this is not so great of a beach compared to others in south florida. There was a sulphur smell the entire trip, but that can't be avoided since the ocean is literally across the street. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The concierge was able to help me book a dolphin watching and snorkeling trip in a matter of minutes, and the trip was a blast! They also provide a shuttle service every hour that goes to the downtown area around Duval st, which is very helpful if you plan on having a few drinks, they also pick up at the same location 15 min after the hour. All in all this hotel was very nice, the extra services made it well worth the price.

However, there was some miscommunication between the front desk and the reservation line, because I was told by the front desk that I could cancel my reservation any time before 6 pm on Sunday, but when I talked to the hotline they said that I would be liable for the room. I then, assured them that I spoke with the hotel about the matter and they said that I would have to call the hotel. I called the hotel, but the young lady was new and did not help me. I called back right before 6pm and the young man on duty assured me that I was not charged. Even though it had been taken care of, I was not called and informed, causing me to stress about paying the extra money for a room that I did not occuoy,

10294849270BklynGirl45533True17FalseFalse2Brooklyn, NY, USA9/[YEAR-0]9/6/[YEAR-0]2Nice Weekend GetawayI was really impressed with this Belvoir, more so than some of the other casino hotels in Atlantic City that are also 3 star accomodations. It is about a 10-15 minute walk away from the Boardwalk/beach and right near the Tanger Outlets, so you have conveinient access to both, yet it is a much more low key hotel compared to the hotels along the Boardwalk, which I liked. I chose a Club Level room, and though my room was on the 12th floor instead of the 15th or 16th floors (which is advertised as where the Club Level rooms are located), I still enjoyed the perks of the Club Louge (evening o'dourves, bottled water/beverages, continental breakfast), which were beyond my expectations. The beds were very comfortable and the front desk staff & house keeping were prompt and courteous with my requests. My only complaints are that some of the furniture and the bathtub were a little scuffed with scratches and one of the lamp's light bulbs was burnt out, but overall, everything was clean and comfortable. I will definitely stay at the hotel again for a nice weekend getaway.

10486536995KrissyB45453True17FalseFalse1Bakersfield, CA9/[YEAR-0]9/10/[YEAR-0]Parking is not free and the hotel will charge $100 to your account at checkin in case of incidents.3Great hotel, but has a few issuesThe rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly. One issue I had was with parking, both my sister and I, as well as another guest we met up with, were under the impression that parking and the shuttle service were free. These important deals were part of the reason we chose this hotel. Much to our dismay, we arrived at the hotel and realized that we had somehow been mistaken, and while the shuttle service to Disneyland was free, parking was not. Not only was parking not free, it was $14 per night! I find this price completely unacceptable. Also, you have to take a ticket when entering that parking lot, but instead of being charged based on this ticket, the parking is charged to your room based on the number of nights you've booked. Because of this, when you leave the parking lot the gate is open and you do not have to turn your ticket in. My issue with this is that any person that is not a guest at the hotel could drive in, take a ticket, park, and then drive out for free since the gate it always open. While they can park for free, I have to pay $14 because I'm STAYING at the hotel? This, to me, is not alright. My other issue was that they took $100 out of my account without any notice at all. I understand that any hotel is going to want to have a credit card on file in case of any incidents, this is pretty standard. Which is why when I arrived at the Belvoir Anaheim and they asked for my card, I was not surprised at all. Since we had paid for our two night stay in advance, I did not expect to see any additional charges on my card. Much to my surprise, when I checked my account later that day, $100 had been taken from my account. When we returned to the hotel that evening, I asked someone at the front desk about the charge and they explained that it was for any incidents and would be returned to my account after our checkout as long as there were no damages or additional charges to the room. I can understand why they do this, my issue is that no one told me about this charge when I checked in, nor was I warned about this charge when I booked the room or in my confirmation... and yes, I did go back and check it. I just think that someone could really be in trouble if they are not planning on an additional $100 coming out of their account, and therefore the staff needs to be sure to inform the guests of this charge. Even better, the guest should be told before booking the hotel that this charge will be taken out at time of checkin. My last issue was that our toilet in our room was difficult to use. We had to flush 2-4 times every time it was used in order to get everything to go down. We decided that we could live with this, so I did not inform staff until we went to the front desk to checkout. When I informed the assistant manager that was checking us out, he only said "ok" and did not thank us or apologize for the broken toilet. He did not seem to be concerned with it at all. Other than the parking, $100 charge, and toilet, I would recommend this hotel. It it beautiful, comfortable, clean, and is the perfect distance from the park.

My wife and I love the facility and plan on staying again many times since it's only a 90 minute drive from home.

One of the best nights sleep too on a great bed. The Belvoir is my new favorite place to stay when in NYC and is very reasonably priced - close to the subway too (N/R lines) - but shop around and you'll come back to reserve here and NOT by one of those "discount" websites but direct worked far better - This hotel should be booked solid every night! I was very disappointed to learn that the wifi I was paying for was only available in my guest room. The trade show I was attending took place largely in the ballroom, so I needed to gain access to the locked wifi in that area of the hotel. When I approached the concierge, she was icy at best and said I would need to speak with someone at the registration desk. I patiently waited in the registration line for twenty minutes, and when I finally was able to speak with someone, he stated that I couldn't gain access to the wifi (despite my offer to pay an additional fee) because the trade show organizers hadn't purchased it. He suggested I speak with the hotel's event coordinator - however that person wouldn't be back in the office until after the trade show was over. I am deeply disappointed in your hotel's policy and weak customer service. I have suggested that the event move to another, more customer-centric venue in the future.

On the 4th night of our stay, I had a nose bleed. I didn't like that I had to ask the staff to change the sheets (we stayed a total of 8 nights)--they should have changed it because the blood on the sheets was visible. Another thing I didn't like was that pool towels were limited to one per guest; two pool towels per guest would be more ideal. The best part about this hotel was its resort fees because it includes 2 bottles of water and in/out parking privileges per room. Overall, this hotel was a good deal.

105353153207Chris8245553True27FalseFalse3Denver, CO9/[YEAR-0]9/11/[YEAR-0]Location is in Downtown, but don't expect it to be bustling with people at night or at weekends, so might have to drive out of the area to do things at those times.2Good choice for Business/Conference TravellerThe hotel was well renovated, decorated and up to date. It's in a perfect location for business/conference traveler, since it's right there where all the office buildings area. For a leisure traveler though, I guess most people will know by now that Dallas downtown is pretty much dead at night or weekends, in exception of small areas of town. Despite of the fact that downtown is dead at night and weekends, the location is only a few blocks away from the art district, Main Street, and West End, you can even take the train to go to those places, which stops pretty much in front of the hotel. All in all it's a pretty good hotel for Belvoir standard, the only complain I have is that the remote control didn't work for the TV menu/movie rental/hotel (check out/hotel info etc). But it wasn't the end of the world, and there were other ways to check out.

We stay here about once a month for an LA getaway.

The hotel staff provided exemplary customer service from the moment we arrived, which continued until we checked-out. I give the Belvoir a 4-star rating on excellent customer service, location, and their BPG rates. The Belvoir is located in the heart of downtown, close to Seattle Art Museum, Convention Center, Fishermans Wharf, Pike Place Market, Space Needle and the shopping district. The city hosts some great restaurants and entertainment venues, all within easy walking distance of the hotel. Rooms are clean and comfortable with nice city views, if you prefer the higher floors. The hotel staff were very accommodating and attentive to our needs, providing an overall great hotel experience. A thank you goes out to the hard working staff for extending gracious hospitality and making us feel welcome. I would definitely not hesitate to stay at the Belvoir Seattle Hotel on our next visit. Highly recommend this hotel for both business or private travel.

10579300377newportbeach5True58FalseFalse4texas9/[YEAR-0]9/12/[YEAR-0]Great Club Lounge & Hotel is Center of all the action! Not a quiet reserve place. Place for fun in the sun.Great Club LoungeThe Club Lounge is one of the nicest and largest in any Belvoir property. The view from the Lounge is fabulous. The 4 to 8pm hors d'uvre is really a full dinner and dessert with complimentary beer and wine. The location was in the heart of busy Waikiki Beach, with everything available to access, shopping, surfing, tours, etc. The hotel is extremely busy and crowded, so don't expect the personal attention, it's not the place to have quiet time. It is a place to have a lot fun with great pools, club, fun music, shopping and great staff. The room decor is somewhat outdated, but clean. The thing that is crazy is the elevator...the button is in the center of the lobby area on each floor (instead of on the wall) and everyone has to turn their head in circles to see which one will be stopping and then run to it, because the elevators are place around in a semi-circle. Really pretty place!

10659921127Irishaco33123False28FalseFalse1New Milford, NJ, USA8/[YEAR-0]9/14/[YEAR-0]Beautiful location2Service challengedBelvoir review To whom it may concern: Wanted to share our experience when recently staying at the Belvoir Marina in San Diego August 24 to 30th. In addition, i shared this review with customer service, but unsurprisingly, did not get a response back. 1. It took 3 calls to the service desk and 2 days for the extra shampoo to be delivered to our room 2. We opted out for the " green" option one of the days. The next day we needed to get our room cleaned and did not post the "green" door sign. Instead, we got the 5 dollar certificate under the door. Realizing the confusion, we promptly returned the certificate to the front desk and specifically asked for the room to be cleaned. We came back at 10 at night to a dirty room. When called the front desk, the cleaning personnel were unwilling to clean the room at first, then agreed, causing us to sit outside till about 11 PM waiting. 3. I lost my sunglasses at the pool. When calling Lost and Found through the Front desk services, I had to make a new claim each day I called to check on the status. Every time I called, there was no record of my previous inquiry. I had to tell the entire story 3 days. Last day of our stay, it sounded like someone actually recorded it, but I can not be sure since that was my last daily follow up. 4. Last night of our stay, I ordered a glass of milk to the room. The hotel charged 3 dollar delivery fee and 20% tax summing up to a modest charge of 10 dollars. Not including two call backs asking to specify the milk I wanted. 5. Finally, the bill arrived at the check out charging us for the room again, though the room was paid for in the beginning of the trip. We had to go to the front desk to dispute the charges. Luckily, all was straightened out within minutes, but it would be nice to avoid that experience in the future. Please take my comments into consideration. That way a hotel this caliber will not appear as inefficient and lacking in service. Sincerely
106696153576MissyfromVA55555True46FalseFalse3Roanoke, VA, USA8/[YEAR-0]9/14/[YEAR-0]You won't find a better place to stay, from the amenities to the staff-top notch all the way3EMERGENCY STAYI came down to FL due to my sister (who lives @ Merritt Island) having an accident and having to be admitted to the ICU at Orlando Medical Center. I checked in very late due to going directly from the airport to the hospital to be with her. I called the shuttle to pick me up at the hospital and Sylvester and the driver (John?) were extremely kind and sympathic and did all they could to help with my unique situation. Arriving at the check in desk exhausted and weary from travelling since 5am. the young man checking me in, (Mike? I hate that the names are slipping my mind as they were all so exceptional) did everything possible to make it so that my stay would be as comfortable & stressfree as possible by upgrading me to the Club level so I could take advantage of having a breakfast and snacks/drinks whenever I was not at the ICU. He made sure that I knew who the club attendant was and called ahead to let her know I was coming up and would probably need a snack and a drink (for sure!). I was met with open arms even though Sue was cleaning up the lounge for the night. She made sure I got all that I needed, was warm and genuine. I found this to be true of all the ladies in the lounge-especially Lillian, who took me and my niece under her wing and treated us like family-her kindness and warm heart were apparent from the start. She also works in the ICU so she had met my niece the day before and remembered her from there. I can't say enough about wonderful things about everyone who touched us during this difficult time and went above and beyond-you just don't find that often these days and all gave stellar service. The hotel was lovely and a welcoming, calm sanctuary each night after the chaos of being at the hospital. Luckily, my sister has a good prognoisis and was released-and although a very scary time in our lives, I'll always recall the kindness and caring that was shown to me and my family. Kudos for Belvoir for allowing their staff the lattitude to be able to step out of the box and really go the extra mile.

10975134814travelingdoc4244353True63FalseFalse3Chicago, IL, USA9/[YEAR-0]9/15/[YEAR-0]Check out water and remote before accepting room;check bill carefully4Room Disappointing, Restaurant Much BetterThis was our second stay at this hotel. Our experience was better the first time when we had no problems with a great room. This time, however, the cold water in the sink only dribbled out. They tried to fix it but could not. They eventually offered us another room late on last day (which we declined). The TV remote also was balky, and they also eventually replaced it. The bill was incorrect (too high) the first and second times they offered it to us. Eventually it was correct. They gave us extra Grandbourne points to compensate. On the plus side the shower water was always fine, the beds were great and the restaurant was much improved at dinner. we particularly liked the option of half portions (which turned out to be quite generous for the seared tuna). Id definitely recommend it! The breakfast buffet was fine, except that they had eliminated the omelets and waffles.

10976163468GrandpaOf733433False53FalseFalse2San Francisco, CA, USA9/[YEAR-0]9/15/[YEAR-0]Not necessarily the best place on earth to do business at a convention.3Okay but PriceyThis is the 3rd year in a row for the convention which brings me to this hotel. In general the facilities are fine and there are lots of local activities which I had limited time to experience. From a business travel standpoint the prices throughout the resort and nearby attractions are significantly above what I would typically spend on a business trip. Food prices are high and drink prices at the bar tend to be as high as the high end hotels in downtown San Francisco. If someone else is paying your travel expenses this is a okay destination. Paying my own expenses as I do I found myself looking constantly to go offsite to the surrounding areas to find more reasonable food prices. The daily resort fee and the parking fee really made the per day cost extremely high for business travel. The conference facilities are fine and they met the needs of the group fairly well. Being a grandfather of 7 I could not imagine bringing my grandkids here unless I hit the lottery. With all the other hotel options in the nearby area I'm sure there are more reasonable rates available. Just because you are at a Disney resort does not mean that you are there to hang with Mickey and should be shouldering the cost of making it the "Happiest place on earth"! Walt must have had a little bit of the bandit in his heart!

10976594127GoodServiceExpected33333True23FalseFalse2Washington DC4/[YEAR-0]9/15/[YEAR-0]Convenient to airport, not convenient to downtown4PleasantConveniently located across from the airport with views of the city and San Diego bay, this is your standard Belvoir with relatively comfortable beds (though a bit stiff, and I really don't understand why hotels use flat sheet that pretty much always come untucked) and friendly staff. The balconies make this hotel stand out from other hotels however, if you're in the Marina tower you can choose from sunrise or sunset views. We opted for the sunset views over the marina and were not disappointed. The pool area was nice and despite complaints we heard, the pool water temperature was not bad. The Club Lounge is a nice perk if you want to grab a bite to eat and some coffee before you start your day. Parking, at $22 a day, seems overpriced, but then parking at every hotel in San Diego seems overpriced, considering there's a large asphalt lot on nearly every other corner. Nevertheless, we've stayed here before and we'll likely stay here again.

The breakfasts were always good and Chris was very friendly and helpful. Most of the time at night it was unattended and not worth the time to go in as the food was unappealing. We complained to the hotel manager before we left. we hope to see our points refunded soon. Also, the air conditioning is set far too cold both in the lobby/atrium area and the Club Room. One day it was set at 68 and that is too cold when you are sitting eating. It is ridiculous and a waste of energy.

11052844377Socrates7435555False58FalseFalse3Edgeley, ND 58433, USA9/[YEAR-0]9/18/[YEAR-0]Do not pay the resort charge unless you truly want the benefits it confers. Do not stay at this hotel, if they advise you that the resort charge is mandatory, for some guests do not pay it.4The Resort ChargeI first stayed at this fine hotel in 1974. Over the years, I have returned frequently. It has been my home, when at Waikiki. The hotel has undergone a number of transformations and refurbishments. This latest incarnation is the best yet. But there is a problem: the so called "mandatory" resort charge. I first learned of this after I had made my reservation for this stay. Being advised by an email from the hotel that the charge was mandatory, I accepted this as fact, and when asked at check in if I knew about the charge, I dutifully replied in the affirmative and paid it. But shortly, the disappointment began, followed by outrage. When I went to log in to the "free" (a benefit of paying the resort charge) WiFi, the screen informed me that the charge would be $14 per day, but IF I were paying the resort charge, it would be free. "IF"? This implied that some hotel guests were not paying the resort charge. Then I noticed costs associated with certain activities in the weekly planner booklet given us. But, other documentation advised us that "IF" we had paid the resort charge, those activities would be free. So, the next day, in a friendly manner, I started asking some hotel guests I randomly met if they had paid the resort charge. It was in this manner that I learned that some had not. Well, it was obvious at that point, anyway. While the list of "benefits" associated with the resort charge is lengthy and interesting, given a proper choice at check in, I would have declined to pay it. The amount was about $125 for our 5 night stay. A better investment would have been 10 Mai Tai's -- 1 for me and 1 for my wife, daily. I did raise this issue at check out, as I was asked if I had any problems during my stay, but of course the response was just a sympathetic smile. Nothing could be done. I have been loyal to the Belvoir Waikiki for nearly 40 years, but I find the imposition of the so-called mandatory resort charge to be deceptive and outrageous. This is no way to treat your loyal customers. It is no way to treat anyone. The next time I travel to Waikiki, I will check to see if your hotel still imposes the resort charge. If it does, I will stay elsewhere. I shall not return until the resort charge is eliminated, and I am advising others headed for Waikiki to do the same. It's a shame really. You have such a fine facility, and such a friendly and competent staff. Yet you have chosen, through management greed, to undermine and negate these strengths through deceptive marketing of a resort charge. If you really need extra income from guests, just build the charge into your rates. I hope to stay with you again some day, but this may have been my last stay. It's up to you. Aloha!

Next you find out that they don't have wireless. Really??? Before I could use the wired option I had to have the ethernet cable replaced due to a broken end piece. Now I'm finally hooked up ready to get some work done while watching Monday night football. My next issue was the TV. It's a beautiful big flat screen and they seem to be up to date because 80% of the channels are HD. Unfortunately none of the HD channels work. I had to scrap the horrible internet that I already paid for and watch the game in the lobby. I also had issues with my toilet. It would run continuously and was very loud so I was constantly jiggling the handle trying to get it to stop in the middle of the night. After my long night I headed to the lobby to find some coffee because no one likes the horrible little coffee makers in the rooms. The coffee never tastes good when it comes out of one of those things. I was happy to see that they had coffee available but unhappy to see that it was $2 per cup. After paying a premium room rate, paying to park (yes you must pay to park here), and paying for internet... Paying $2 for coffee was a little more than irritating. I will not be using this hotel again.

112368861469Anonymous55555True16FalseFalse1San Bruno, CA, USA9/[YEAR-0]9/24/[YEAR-0]It is so spacious and the surrounding nature is astoundingly beautiful.1I WILL be coming back!Planning our Hawaii trip was so stressful, with all the options we got overwhelmed, but I'm glad that we finally selected the Belvoir in Kona. Such a great decision! My Nana and I had many many remarks about how spacious it is at this hotel, it is like the space took a giant inhalation and has suspended itself in time. If you love the water, this place is for you! I took the trolley many of our snorkeling, snuba, and swimming adventures. There is also a pier in walking distance away where you can hop on a boat to go out to great snorkeling spots, rent a kayak, or a paddleboard. The free breakfast was one of my favorite reasons for being here. And the beds were wonderful, I overheard other guests saying this too. The staff was so kind!! And the pools are beautiful. Once I saw dolphins in the ocean as I was walking around the spacious, beautiful gardens right next to the pool. This is a great spot! The trolley was really nice too. We were there for a week without renting a car, but after 1 week it seems like a car is needed. I had a great time at this place =. There are many events in the mornings, like hula lessons and yoga. Once I walked around the lava rocks in the morning, at the edge of the ocean just outside of the hotel, and there is so much life there!! It was beautiful. Beautiful beautiful beautiful. Oh! If you can, visit the fern rainforest and lava tube, it is on the other side of the island, but definitely worth the trip.

11236942380Mandolinman23442False64FalseFalse2Salem, OR, USA9/[YEAR-0]9/24/[YEAR-0]Parking at the hotel is terrible.4Parking garage is the worstIf your travel to Honolulu does not involve use of an automobile, then the Belvoir Princess is okay--not great, but fair. Staff is polite and helpful, rooms are small but tolerable if you are on a budget, food is quite expensive--lots of better restaurant choices. BUT--if you have a rental (or borrowed) car, forget the Belvoir Princess!! The parking garage is a hopeless maze, and if you have any problems with stairs then don't even bother. The low point of our stay in Honolulu was the SP garage. I suggest you go elsewhere.
11237065127ChrisT35244True43FalseFalse3Sacramento, CA, USA9/[YEAR-0]9/24/[YEAR-0]Beautiful property, poor staff4Great facility but staff needs workThe property is beautiful and the room had a wonderful view of the Coronado bridge and downtown. The room was clean and comfortable, however, the staff is well below Grandbourne standards. I checked in early and they were to call me on my cell when my room was ready. Several hours later I checked at the desk and the room was ready but no one ever called. The staff did not go over any Gold options, did not explain the Wi-Fi (some Belvoir's you have an access code other you just log on and hope the bill is credited), did not offer a 4:00 PM checkout and when I went to use the Club Room my key was not programmed for access requiring an additional trip to the desk. When I went to check my bags while I was waiting for my room the two people at the bell desk sat there and talked about work for five minutes while I waited. I know it was five minutes as by then I was curious to see how inattentive this staff could be so I was looking at my watch. Now I just checked my personal credit card (the one on my profile) and they charged my stay on that card and not the card I presented at check-in although the room was not a prepay. I now must attempt to credit one card and charge the other (Grandbourne billing is another nightmare as I'm still waiting for a call regarding a stay in August). The upside is I lived in San Diego for eight years and the renovation of the property was excellent as I know what it used to look like. Honestly, I would stay there again as the views and room were wonderful but don't expect Grandbourne standards with the staff.

The hotel bar is larger than most hotel bars and one of the few that has several TVs to catch your favorite game on. The lobby is immaculate and includes Starbucks and Pizza Hut items. 1125206695TravelingFamilyof445444True36TrueTrue2Houston, TX, USA9/[YEAR-0]9/25/[YEAR-0]You will be well received and Club Level Service options are Exceptional.4An Attitude To Serve!!We were greeted and welcomed by the Valet Attendant| Doorman. His name losses me, but his mannerisms and etiquette(s) were well received by my wife and our two young boys. Upon check-in we received our room registration keys and our "BPG Welcome Letter". Our room was appointed and met our level of comfort. On the next morning my wife inquired about the "Grandbourne Gym-In-The-Bag" as advertised on the hotel information screen. She placed a call to the Sunday AM Front Desk Agent, but they did not know what was "Gym-In-The-Bag". The front desk supervisor did not know about this particular service or option, but extended her an invite to use the gym facilities. The Club Level Breakfast was hosted by Ms. Monique, a hospitality professional with personality and a friendly touch. Food was hot, well stocked, beverages were refreshing and plentiful. We sat in the overflow in the front of the room and enjoyed the spacious and cushioned seating on the chairs and couch. Check-out was Great! Called for valet and the same gentleman who name I can not recall, Was Back On-Duty. My two young boys were as excited as I was to see him return to check us out. He called prior to his arrival to check to see if we were ready to receive him. That was Just the WOW Factor you can appreciate from a service provider. An we showed our appreciation when he assisted us to our vehicle. THANK YOU Belvoir for An Attitude of Serve!!

Then the clerk made me stand and wait to be checked in while she dealt with an airline representative who was dropping off luggage for a guest. Once I was finally checked in and I went upstairs to my room, I was shocked to find the room not cleaned. There were empty soda, beer and liquor boxes and other trash left in a closet. Also left in the closet was a foil pan with fried chicken and baked beans, obviously left over from a party. The next morning, upon pulling back the shower curtain, there was hair in the floor of the shower stall. Long, dark, quite obvious if the housekeeping staff had bothered to look in the shower to see if it needed cleaning.

It looked like they were distracted or in a hurry as they only did half the job. But front desk and valet were very courteous and friendly. Overall, a great stay. Will definitely stay there again.

11282124994medic14954554True2FalseFalse29/[YEAR-0]9/26/[YEAR-0]First stay and more to comeThis was my first stay at this hotel. The hotel staff was great. Only issue is location. It is smack dab in the middle of the "Chinatown" of Queens. Most all of the resturaunts in the area did not have menus in English and did not take credit cards. Since the hotel restaraunt was so good, it wasn't an issue for us. The rooms were very quiet from outside noise, but could hear people in hall and other rooms a little bit. Will always stay here when I'm in the area. Thanks!!

11284396353Hollenex24142False38FalseFalse2New Orleans, LA, USA9/[YEAR-0]9/26/[YEAR-0]2What happened to this hotel?!!!We have stayed at the Belvoir on Canal in New Orleans many times in the past, usually during Mardi Gras, so we are familiar with this hotel and how it functions at the busiest of times. The good-The location is great, the staff are friendly and we were pleased to see that the rooms have been updated. The bad-the elevators are terrible! They are not traditional in that you don't just push a button at the elevator bank and wait for the first one. These elevators require you to enter your floor number, then it flashes a car number for you to wait for. Sounds easy, and as though it would be more efficient but, it doesn't work out well in reality. I can't tell you how many people I've seen that are confused by this, end up getting frustrated and holding things up. The line to get to the elevator during Mardi Gras is just awful! Don't expect to get up to your room or down to the lobby quickly if it's a busy time. Now, the ugly-our most recent visit was 9/22/12. The hotel is in the process of renovating the lobby so it now feels kind of like an airline terminal that is also under construction (hopefully that will improve!) We had requested an early check in but were delayed in arriving due to convention traffic and didn't arrive till 3 pm. There was a line to check in that wasn't too long but, we were told that our room had not been cleaned yet and so we couldn't check in. I gave them my cell phone number to call when the room was ready and was assured that it would be less than an hour. An hour and a half later we still hadn't gotten a call and had to get back into a much longer check in line where we remained for another 20-30 min. When we finally got to the desk we were told a room was still not available and they didn't know how much longer it would be. There were not enough attendants to check all the guests in and we were not the only ones unable to check in-there were 30-40 people sitting in chairs in the lobby area with their luggage, some curled up on pillows some laying down on the floor- it looked like we were at an airport that had been snowed in, cancelled all flights and passengers were bedding down! We had dinner reservations, we're meeting friends and were looking forward to some time alone without the kids (got the 'romance package' that was supposed to come with chocolates and champagne in the room-never did get those). Spending the few hours we had together in a line sucked. We were persistent (refused to move till we got a room) and got a room within 20 minutes but missed our dinner reservation and were late to meet our friends. The hotel did try to compensate us but, I would've rather had it go right. We chose the Belvoir because they usually are on the ball with check in compared to many other N.O. Hotels. Something has changed and that is no longer true. Cheaping out on staff? Poor management? Who knows, I just know I won't be staying there come next Mardi Gras!

113796981236RavensFan55555True56FalseFalse2Maryland, USA9/[YEAR-0]9/29/[YEAR-0]Great staff and great location to downtown.3Belvoir Downtown Nashville - <>My wife and I stayed at the Belvoir Downtown on Saturday thru Tuesday. We were extremely pleased with the Belvoir and the close proximately (walking distance) to everything downtown. The real Nashville experience, the music, the original Grand Ole Opry, the Hall of Fame, music & museum, the bars and the historical atmosphere, all happens on Broadway and the surrounding streets. For most other things, you need a car or taxi. We ate at the Bistro on the second floor, once for a delightful lunch sandwich and again for a scrumptious breakfast. We thoroughly enjoyed the view - I had requested a high floor. The size of the room was great and provided all the space and comfort one could wish for. We had one minor bathroom issue, which was fixed immediately, once we notified the staff actually spoke to a very nice gentleman, an electrical or maintenance supervisor, I believe, on the elevator. Parking in and out was easy and was included in the package I paid for. . Go Orioles and Ravens.
